issue.title: [C++] DICTIONARY_REPLACEMENT neither read nor written
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-11419](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-11419). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
The IPC format has a feature field DICTIONARY_REPLACEMENT to advertise the use of dictionary replacement but it is not emitted by the IPC writer, even if dictionary replacement occurred.

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-11419?focusedCommentId=17273910) by Antoine Pitrou (apitrou):*
It seems the Java doesn't do this either, at least by doing a quick grep over the sources.

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-11419?focusedCommentId=17276060) by Micah Kornfield (emkornfield):*
this is accurate, I thought I had a Jira to track implementation.  I added the enum early because we were reaching 1.0 and it would have been a forward compatible change to add it.  So there is not implementation to date.
